sn35.82:2.3: The Pali puns lujjati (“wear away”) with loka (“world”). Normally lujjati is “fall apart, disintegrate” (see SN 22.93), but where it puns with “world” (here and SN 35.84) I translate as “wear away”, which is justified by the use at AN 3.132:1.7. This pun might seem obvious to “world-weary” folks of today, but it is the deliberate opposite of loka’s underlying sense. It originally referred to “light”, especially the bright lights of the heavens, hence “cosmos” and “world” generally. See note on MN 7:19.6 for details.
